TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Serializable extends Urho.UrhoObject

Docs.summary: Base class for objects with automatic serialization through attributes.

MemberSignature.Value: public Serializable ();
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

summary.para: Constructs a new instance of Urho.Serializable which is tied to the .

MemberSignature.Value: public Serializable (IntPtr handle);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(native int handle) cil managed

Docs.param: Pointer to the raw unmanaged Urho object.
Docs.summary: Constructs a new instance of Urho.Serializable, given a raw pointer to an unmanaged object

remarks.para: This creates a new managed wrapper for the type using the raw pointer to an unmanaged object.
Objects that are created in this fashion get registered with the UrhoSharp runtime.
This is intended to be used by the UrhoSharp runtime, and is not intended to be used by users.

MemberSignature.Value: public Serializable (Urho.Context context);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Urho.Context context) cil managed

Docs.param: The context that this object will be attached to.

summary.para: Constructs a new instance of Urho.Serializable linked to a specific .

MemberSignature.Value: protected Serializable (Urho.UrhoObjectFlag emptyFlag);
.method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype Urho.UrhoObjectFlag emptyFlag) cil managed

Docs.summary: Empty constructor, chain to this constructor when you provide your own constructor that sets the handle field.

remarks.para: This constructor should be invoked by your code if you provide your own constructor that sets the handle field.
This essentially circumvents the default path that creates a new object and sets the handle and does not call RegisterObject on the target, you must do this on your own constructor.
You would typically chain to this constructor from your own, and then set the handle to the unmanaged object from your code, and then register your object.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetInterceptNetworkUpdate (string attributeName, bool enable);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetInterceptNetworkUpdate(string attributeName, bool enable) cil managed

Docs.summary: Enable interception of an attribute from network updates. Intercepted attributes are sent as events instead of applying directly. This can be used to implement client side prediction.

MemberSignature.Value: public Urho.Subscription SubscribeToInterceptNetworkUpdate (Action<Urho.InterceptNetworkUpdateEventArgs> handler);
.method public hidebysig instance class Urho.Subscription SubscribeToInterceptNetworkUpdate(class System.Action`1<valuetype Urho.InterceptNetworkUpdateEventArgs> handler) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("SubscribeTo API may lead to unxpected behaviour and will be removed in a future version. Use C# event '.InterceptNetworkUpdate += ...' instead.")

Docs.param: The handler to invoke when this event is raised.
Docs.summary: Subscribes to the InterceptNetworkUpdate event raised by the Serializable.
Docs.returns: Returns an Urho.Subscription that can be used to cancel the subscription.

remarks.para: This method will override any prior subscription, including those assigned to on event handlers.
This has the advantage that it does a straight connection and returns a handle that is easy to unsubscribe from.
For a more event-like approach, use the event.

MemberSignature.Value: public Urho.Subscription SubscribeToTemporaryChanged (Action<Urho.TemporaryChangedEventArgs> handler);
.method public hidebysig instance class Urho.Subscription SubscribeToTemporaryChanged(class System.Action`1<valuetype Urho.TemporaryChangedEventArgs> handler) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("SubscribeTo API may lead to unxpected behaviour and will be removed in a future version. Use C# event '.TemporaryChanged += ...' instead.")

Docs.param: The handler to invoke when this event is raised.
Docs.summary: Subscribes to the TemporaryChanged event raised by the Serializable.
Docs.returns: Returns an Urho.Subscription that can be used to cancel the subscription.

remarks.para: This method will override any prior subscription, including those assigned to on event handlers.
This has the advantage that it does a straight connection and returns a handle that is easy to unsubscribe from.
For a more event-like approach, use the event.

remarks.para: The event can register multiple callbacks and invoke all of them. If this is not desired, and you only need a single shot callback, you can use the method. That one will force that callback and will ignore any previously set events here.
